Name: Ainslie's
Description: Historic blended Scotch from James Ainslie & Co. of Leith (est. 1868); the firm famously acquired and rebuilt Clynelish during the late-19th-century whisky boom.

Name: Alex Ferguson
Description: A vintage blended Scotch from A. Ferguson & Co. (unrelated to the football manager), with bottlings dating to around the 1930s.

Name: Anchor
Description: “Scottish Anchor” is a premium blended Scotch bottled by Douglas Laing, known from ceramic decanter releases such as Admiral’s Select.

Name: Angels' Nectar
Description: A blended malt from Highfern inspired by the angels’ share, crafted from Highland and Speyside malts and bottled at natural colour.

Name: Antiquary
Description: Victorian-era blend named after Sir Walter Scott’s novel; Edinburgh-born and recently revived with new age-stated expressions.

Name: Ardray
Description: Contemporary blended Scotch launched in 2023, created by Beam Suntory with Japanese blending artistry and malts/grains from renowned Scotch distilleries.

Name: Auchnagie
Description: A blended malt from The Lost Distillery Company that recreates the style of the long-closed Auchnagie distillery in Perthshire.

Name: Auld Alliance
Description: A commemorative William Grant & Sons blend marrying Scotch whisky with French Armagnac, celebrating the historic Franco-Scottish ‘Auld Alliance’.

Name: Ballantine's
Description: Global blended Scotch brand tracing back to 1827 and George Ballantine; today produced by Chivas Brothers (Pernod Ricard).

Name: Barker's
Description: Historic blended Scotch label noted by specialist retailers, with vintage-era bottlings occasionally seen on the secondary market.

Name: Baxter's
Description: Old blended Scotch brand associated with James Watson & Co., known from bottlings such as Baxter’s Barley Bree in the mid-20th century.

Name: Bell's
Description: One of the UK’s best-known blended Scotches, originally from Arthur Bell & Sons and now part of Diageo.

Name: Ben Nevis
Description: Highland single malt distillery at Fort William, owned by Japan’s Nikka since 1989 and famed for robust, waxy spirit.

Name: Berry Bros & Rudd
Description: Historic London wine & spirits merchant and independent bottler; creator of the Cutty Sark brand and producer of modern ‘Classic Range’ whiskies.

Name: Big Ben
Description: Novelty decanter/blended Scotch line sold in an Elizabeth Tower–shaped 50cl bottle, typically featuring easy-drinking Highland/Speyside style.

Name: Big Peat
Description: Islay blended malt from Douglas Laing, a small-batch marriage of malts that has included Ardbeg, Caol Ila, Bowmore and Port Ellen.

Name: Big T
Description: Long-running blended Scotch produced by Tomatin, first released in the late 19th century and still associated with the distillery today.

Name: Black & White
Description: Classic Buchanan’s blend now owned by Diageo, famous for its Scottie and Westie terriers and strong international following.

Name: Black Bottle
Description: Blend dating to 1879 from the Graham brothers (tea blenders), today under Distell/Heineken Beverages and known for a gently smoky profile.

Name: Black Bull
Description: Historic blended Scotch revived by Duncan Taylor; known for high-strength, malt-forward blends (e.g., 50/50 malt-to-grain) and age-stated releases up to 55 years.

Name: Blue Spot
Description: Mitchell & Son single pot still Irish whiskey, aged a minimum 7 years in bourbon, sherry and Madeira casks and bottled at cask strength.

Name: Buchanan's
Description: Blended Scotch brand founded in 1884 by James Buchanan; now a Diageo label with strong popularity in Latin America and the US.

Name: Bulloch Lade
Description: Once a major blender/owner (incl. Caol Ila), famed for BL Gold Label; the company collapsed after WWI but the brand endured for decades.

Name: Burberrys
Description: Scarce fashion-house bottlings (blended and single malt) commissioned by Burberrys of London—e.g., 12-year and vintage-dated releases.

Name: Busker
Description: Irish whiskey brand from Royal Oak Distillery (owned by Illva Saronno) with a blended core and a ‘Single Collection’ (malt, pot still, grain), often triple-cask matured.

Name: Caisteal Chamuis
Description: Heavily peated ‘Island style’ blended malt from Mossburn (Torabhaig’s sister brand), named after a Skye castle and finished in bourbon barrels for balance.

Name: Campbeltown Loch
Description: Blended malt created by J&A Mitchell (Springbank), marrying Campbeltown single malts for a maritime style.

Name: Chequers
Description: Historic Leith-born blend (1863), later part of DCL; long exported and often associated with Linkwood-forward recipes.

Name: Chivas
Description: Flagship blended Scotch brand from Chivas Brothers, known for premium blends and global reach.

Name: Chivas Regal
Description: Luxury blended Scotch range introduced in 1909 with an original 25-year-old expression; a mainstay of the Chivas portfolio.

Name: Cladach
Description: Coastal-themed blended malt from Diageo’s Special Releases 2018, drawing on seaside distilleries for a salty-sweet profile.

Name: Clonakilty
Description: West Cork Irish whiskey brand and distillery (opened 2019), releasing cask-finished single batch and single grain whiskies.

Name: Coilltean
Description: A Samaroli independent-bottling series (the name is Gaelic for ‘woodlands’), featuring rare single malts such as 1992 Macallan and 1975 Glen Garioch.

Name: Collection Moon
Description: Blended malt label from Italy’s Moon Import, with vintage-era releases (e.g., 12-year-old bottlings believed from the late 1980s/early 1990s).

Name: Collectivum XXVIII
Description: A Diageo Special Releases 2017 blended malt marrying whiskies from 28 active malt distilleries across Scotland.

Name: Compass Box
Description: Modern Scotch blending house founded in 2000 by John Glaser, known for innovative, transparent blends like Spice Tree and The Peat Monster.

Name: Connacht
Description: Irish distillery brand from Ballina, County Mayo, producing single malt and pot still whiskey; recently announced a name change to Ballina Distillery.

Name: Connemara
Description: Peated Irish single malt created at Cooley (Kilbeggan Distilling/Beam Suntory), long noted as the only widely available peated Irish whiskey.

Name: Copper Dog
Description: Speyside blended malt first created at the Craigellachie Hotel; a fruit-forward marriage of eight single malts, now part of the Diageo portfolio.

Name: Crabbie
Description: Historic John Crabbie & Co. brand revived in Edinburgh; releases include an 8-year-old Highland single malt alongside limited single casks.

Name: Craig Athol
Description: Now-vanished blended Scotch linked to Arthur Bell & Sons/Blair Athol; bottles from the 1970s–80s occasionally surface at auction.

Name: Crawford's
Description: Leith-born blended Scotch from A&A Crawford (est. 1860), best known for its 3 Star and later 5 Star expressions.

Name: Cutty Sark
Description: Blended Scotch created in 1923 by Berry Bros. & Rudd; produced today by La Martiniquaise and noted for a lighter, naturally coloured style.

Name: Dawson's
Description: Historic blended Scotch associated with Peter Dawson, an early 20th-century blender later absorbed into DCL.

Name: Dewar's
Description: Global blended Scotch from John Dewar & Sons, a pioneer of blending since the late 19th century.

Name: Dimple
Description: Haig’s Dimple (aka Dimple Pinch), a classic blended Scotch introduced in 1893 by John Haig & Co.

Name: Drumshanbo
Description: Irish single pot still whiskey from The Shed Distillery in Drumshanbo; triple distilled with barley and oats and matured in bourbon and Oloroso sherry casks.

Name: Dubliner
Description: Irish whiskey brand from the Dublin Liberties Distillery; known for Bourbon Cask and liqueur variants.

Name: Duncan Taylor
Description: Independent Scotch bottler founded in 1938 (Huntly), known for releasing whiskies from a large private cask collection and brands like Black Bull.

Name: Dunhill
Description: Dunhill Old Master was a 1970s blended Scotch created by IDV exclusively for the London retailer Dunhill.

Name: Dunville's
Description: Historic Irish brand revived in 2013 by Echlinville Distillery; releases include Dunville’s VR and Three Crowns.

Name: Egan's
Description: Irish whiskey brand tracing to P. & H. Egan (est. 1852 in Tullamore), revived for modern single malts and blends.

Name: Elements of Islay
Description: Elixir Distillers’ range celebrating Islay styles, featuring small-batch blended malts and limited single malts (launched mid-2000s).

Name: Epicurean
Description: Douglas Laing Lowland blended malt noted for fresh, grassy character and cocktail-friendly profile.

Name: Fable
Description: Independent Scotch bottler (Pendulum Spirits, 2020) focusing on single casks and storytelling-led blended malts.

Name: Famous Grouse
Description: Iconic blended Scotch introduced in 1896 and long among Scotland’s best-selling whiskies.

Name: Fercullen
Description: Irish whiskey brand from Powerscourt Distillery in County Wicklow, spanning malt, grain, and blends.

Name: Findlater's
Description: Historic blended Scotch label from Findlater, Mackie, Todd & Co., a 19th–20th-century merchant bottler, known for age-stated blends and special decanters.

Name: Flaming Pig
Description: Irish blended whiskey finished in intensely charred bourbon casks for added spice and gentle smokiness.

Name: Friar John Cor
Description: Modern Scotch range from Lindores Abbey referencing the 1494 Exchequer Rolls; includes limited cask-strength single malt releases.

Name: Gilbey's
Description: W.&A. Gilbey’s historic Scotch blends (e.g., Spey Royal), stemming from the London wine & spirits merchant’s early 20th-century move into whisky.

Name: Gilmour Thomson's
Description: Leith-based blender best known for early 20th-century bottlings like Royal Blend; the J.G. Thomson name has been revived for small-batch whiskies.

Name: Gladstone Axe
Description: Contemporary blended malt composed of Highland and Islay single malts; 100% malted barley, aged in oak, released in characterful decanters.

Name: Glen Garry
Description: Long-running blended Scotch label historically bottled by firms like John Hopkins & Co.; sometimes confused with Loch Lomond’s ‘Glengarry’.

Name: Glendrostan
Description: Vintage blended Scotch brand associated with Longman Distillers; 1980s bottlings claim an ‘original recipe’ predating 1780.

Name: Glenleven
Description: Blended malt Scotch from the House of Haig, sold mainly in the 1960s–80s.

Name: Glenrosa
Description: Historic blended Scotch label with mid-20th-century bottlings; the name has appeared on later blended releases as well.

Name: Gold Spot
Description: Mitchell & Son single pot still Irish whiskey; limited editions have included 9-year and 13-year expressions with wine-cask components.

Name: Golden Age
Description: John Haig & Co. blended Scotch popular in the 1970s and discontinued in the early 1980s.

Name: Golden Heather
Description: Vintage blended Scotch label (e.g., late-1940s/1950s bottlings) associated with Paten & Co.

Name: Grand Coronation
Description: Blended Scotch seen in mid-20th-century US market bottlings; examples cite Pristine Liquor Co. as bottler.

Name: Grant's
Description: Major blended Scotch brand from William Grant & Sons, introduced in the late 19th century and among the world’s top sellers.

Name: Green Spot
Description: Single pot still Irish whiskey from the historic ‘Spot’ range of Mitchell & Son, matured in bourbon and sherry casks.

Name: Haig
Description: Historic Scotch brand of John Haig & Co.; long-running blends such as Haig Gold/De Luxe preceded modern offshoots.

Name: Haig Club
Description: Contemporary single grain Scotch from Cameronbridge, launched with Diageo and David Beckham; designed for a modern, lighter style.

Name: Hankey Bannister
Description: Historic blended Scotch founded in 1757 and now produced by Inver House Distillers (ThaiBev), long associated with society patrons.

Name: Hart Brothers
Description: Independent Scotch bottler (origins in the 19th–20th c.) known for cask-strength single casks and selected blends across all regions.

Name: Harvey's
Description: Blended Scotch label from the historic Bristol wine & spirits merchant, seen in vintage-era bottlings alongside the famous sherries.

Name: Hazelwood
Description: House of Hazelwood—rare, aged Scotch blends from the Gordon family’s long-matured cask collection based in Dufftown.

Name: Heather Dew
Description: Collectible blended Scotch from Mitchell Brothers of Glasgow, famed for ‘Greybeard’ ceramic jugs and mid-20th-century bottlings.

Name: Highland Harvest
Description: Organic Scotch label releasing blends and single malts, including independent-bottled organic expressions.

Name: Hogshead
Description: Blended malt Scotch bottled by Signatory Vintage, typically a marriage of malts with a noted Islay component.

Name: House of Commons
Description: Official parliamentary blended Scotch—historic bottlings by Buchanan’s or Gordon & MacPhail; current ‘Parliamentarian’ produced for the Commons.

Name: The Irishman
Description: Modern Irish whiskey brand from Walsh Whiskey, noted for single malt, single pot still, and premium cask-finished expressions.

Name: Islay Mist
Description: Classic blended Scotch marrying peaty Islay malt with gentler Highland/Speyside components, originally created for a local celebration on Islay.

Name: Isle of Skye
Description: Blended Scotch from Ian Macleod Distillers, traditionally built around Island and Highland malts for a lightly smoky, heather-honey style.

Name: J & G Stewart
Description: Historic Edinburgh blending house whose name appears on vintage blended Scotches; associated with elegant, well-aged house blends.

Name: J&B
Description: Global blended Scotch brand Justerini & Brooks, renowned for its bright, approachable style and long export history.

Name: James Eadie
Description: Revived Victorian whisky name producing single cask bottlings and the ‘Trade Mark X’ blended Scotch based on an 1870s recipe.

Name: James Haddow
Description: Vintage-era blended Scotch label linked to Glasgow merchants; bottles from the mid-20th century occasionally surface at auction.

Name: Jameson
Description: Blended Irish whiskey from Irish Distillers (Pernod Ricard); triple-distilled and aged a minimum of four years, the world’s best-selling Irish whiskey.

Name: J.J. Corry
Description: Revived Irish whiskey bonder founded by Louise McGuane in County Clare, curating and blending sourced Irish whiskeys under named releases like The Hanson.

Name: John Player Special
Description: Vintage blended Scotch brand tied to the John Player tobacco marque; 1980s bottlings were blended/bottled by Langside Distillers for export markets.

Name: Johnnie Walker
Description: Global Scotch whisky brand founded in Kilmarnock in 1820 and now produced by Diageo; renowned for its coloured-label blends.

Name: Kilbeggan
Description: Traditional Irish whiskey brand from the historic Kilbeggan Distillery; typically double-distilled for a classic smooth style.

Name: King William IV
Description: Rare blended Scotch produced by John Gillon & Co. for export markets; examples include 1950s–80s bottlings.

Name: King’s Choice
Description: Mid-20th-century blended Scotch label bottled by Stewart, Pott & Co., seen in 1960s–70s releases for continental markets.

Name: Kirker & Greer
Description: Belfast-based Irish whiskey blender/brand releasing triple-distilled blends (e.g., Shamrock) and age-stated expressions from sourced stocks.

Name: Knappogue Castle
Description: Irish single malt brand named after a 15th-century castle; known for age-stated, bourbon-cask-led releases like the 12 Year.

Name: Knightrider
Description: Vintage blended Scotch label with documented 1960s bottlings, typically released for export markets.

Name: Laird O' Logan
Description: De Luxe blended Scotch from White Horse Distillers, seen in 12-year expressions during the 1970s–80s.

Name: Lauder's
Description: Long-running blended Scotch first created in 1834; today part of the MacDuff International portfolio.

Name: Logan
Description: Early-20th-century White Horse blend with a loyal following, especially in Iberian markets.

Name: Logan's
Description: Market variant of the Logan blended Scotch (often ‘De Luxe’), appearing on mid-to-late-20th-century bottlings.

Name: Long John
Description: Historic blended Scotch now under Pernod Ricard; traditionally a Highland-style blend with strong sales in France.

Name: Lord Elcho
Description: Blended Scotch from Wemyss Malts, crafted with a high malt content and a fruit-forward house style.

Name: Mackintosh
Description: Modern blended malt Scotch marrying Highland and Speyside components for a soft, fruity profile.

Name: MacNair's
Description: Blended malt and small-batch Scotch (e.g., Lum Reek) from The GlenAllachie Distillers Company, revived under Billy Walker’s stewardship.

Name: MacNaMara
Description: Hebridean blended Scotch from Pràban na Linne (The Gaelic Whiskies) on Skye, typically light, coastal and gently peated.

Name: McConnell's
Description: Historic Belfast Irish whiskey brand (founded 1776) revived with blends and single malts.

Name: Method and Madness
Description: Experimental Irish Distillers brand from Midleton’s micro distillery, exploring unusual woods and mashbills.

Name: Midleton
Description: Prestige Irish whiskey label best known for Midleton Very Rare—annual vintage releases blended at the Midleton distillery.

Name: Mitchells & Butlers
Description: Birmingham brewer’s blended Scotch label, seen on mid-20th-century age-stated bottlings and decanters.

Name: Monarch Of The Highlands
Description: Traditional blended Scotch brand drawing on Highland malts; vintage bottlings were widely exported.

Name: Monkey Shoulder
Description: Blended malt Scotch from William Grant & Sons, crafted for mixing and sipping with a soft, malty profile.

Name: Mossburn
Description: Independent Scotch bottler/brand (sister to Torabhaig) releasing regional blended malts and single cask selections.

Name: Neal's
Description: Vintage blended Scotch brand from UK wine & spirit merchants; mid-20th-century bottlings appear at auction.

Name: Nectar of the Daily Drams
Description: Independent bottling series from Belgian importer The Nectar, releasing small-batch single malts and blends from Scottish distilleries.

Name: Noble Rebel
Description: Contemporary blended malt from Loch Lomond Group, crafted by Master Blender Michael Henry with editions like Smoke Symphony and Orchard Outburst.

Name: Nomad
Description: ‘Outland’ whisky created by González Byass with Whyte & Mackay—blended and aged in Scotland before a sherry-cask finish in Jerez.

Name: Old Bannockburn
Description: Historic Deanston single malt label first used for the distillery’s earliest releases in the 1970s.

Name: Old Comber
Description: Revived Irish single pot still brand from Echlinville, rooted in the old Comber Distilleries; modern releases feature heritage mashbills and cask finishes.

Name: Old Court
Description: Vintage blended Scotch bottled by A. Gillies & Co. (Glen Scotia owners), with age-stated expressions for export markets.

Name: Old Parr
Description: Deluxe blended Scotch (Grand Old Parr) launched in 1909; a Diageo brand with major popularity in Latin America and Japan.

Name: Old Perth
Description: Sherry-matured blended malt from Morrison, blended in Perth and focused on rich, Speyside-driven profiles.

Name: Old Rarity
Description: De Luxe blended Scotch from Bulloch Lade & Co., with classic decanter and 12-year releases dating from the mid-20th century.

Name: Orbital
Description: An eight-year ‘world blend’ created by Whisky Magazine—tastings samples married with aged grain and finished in PX sherry cask to raise funds for charity.

Name: Paddy
Description: Long-running blended Irish whiskey brand with Cork roots; renamed ‘Paddy’ in 1912 and today produced under Sazerac ownership.

Name: Peat Chimney
Description: Wemyss Malts blended malt highlighting Islay smoke in a balanced, maritime style.

Name: Pig's Nose
Description: Approachable blended Scotch from Ian Macleod Distillers, known for its soft, easy-drinking character.

Name: Pinwinnie
Description: Vintage blended Scotch label (e.g., ‘Pinwinnie Royale’) with widely traded 1980s–90s bottlings.

Name: Pogues
Description: Band-branded Irish whiskey produced in West Cork, released as a blended expression.

Name: Poit Dhubh
Description: Gaelic Whiskies’ non chill filtered blended malt from Skye—peat-accented and released at various ages.

Name: Portgordon
Description: Blended malt Scotch associated with Portgordon Maltings commemorative releases (e.g., 1980s ‘Celebration Blend’).

Name: Powers
Description: Historic Irish whiskey brand from Irish Distillers, famed for pot still–led character and bottlings like Powers Gold Label and John’s Lane 12.

Name: Proper No. Twelve
Description: Modern blended Irish whiskey launched by Eire Born Spirits, triple-distilled and designed for a smooth, approachable style.

Name: Pure Scot
Description: Contemporary blended Scotch created by the team behind Bladnoch, combining malt and grain for a versatile, cocktail-friendly profile.

Name: Putachieside
Description: De Luxe blended Scotch historically produced by William Sanderson & Son (of VAT 69), widely exported in the mid-20th century.

Name: Red Spot
Description: Mitchell & Son single pot still Irish whiskey—15 years old—matured in a mix of bourbon, sherry and Marsala casks.

Name: Redbreast
Description: Iconic single pot still Irish whiskey from Midleton, with age-stated core bottlings and sherry-forward special editions.

Name: Robert Burns (Arran)
Description: Officially endorsed Arran brand featuring a mellow blended Scotch and a fruity single malt, named for Scotland’s national poet.

Name: Rock Island
Description: Douglas Laing blended malt celebrating Scotland’s islands; a maritime, lightly smoky whisky formerly known as Rock Oyster.

Name: Roe & Co
Description: Dublin-based Irish whiskey brand from Diageo, named after historic distiller George Roe and crafted for a fruit-vanilla house style.

Name: Royal Household
Description: Prestige blended Scotch historically bottled for the British Royal Household; today best known as a limited export release, notably in Japan.

Name: Royal Salute
Description: Prestige blended Scotch launched in 1953 to mark Queen Elizabeth II’s coronation; all core expressions are 21 years or older.

Name: Sailor's Home
Description: Modern Irish whiskey brand inspired by Limerick’s maritime heritage, releasing blends and single malts with cask finishes (e.g., rum, Madeira).

Name: Samuel Webster & Sons.
Description: Historic UK brewer–merchant label seen on mid-20th-century blended Scotch bottlings and decanters for the retail trade.

Name: Sandy Macdonald
Description: Long-running de luxe blended Scotch with strong export presence, historically linked to Macdonald Greenlees of Edinburgh.

Name: Sandy Macnab's
Description: Traditional blended Scotch label from Glasgow merchants, remembered for gift decanters and easy-drinking house style.

Name: Savoy
Description: Historic blended Scotch associated with the famed London hotel name; produced by various bottlers for domestic and export markets.

Name: Scallywag
Description: Douglas Laing Speyside blended malt celebrated for sherry-rich, fruity character; part of the ‘Remarkable Regional Malts’ range.

Name: Scotland's Ripe Old Age
Description: Vintage blended Scotch brand widely exported in the mid-20th century, often in age-stated decanters and presentation bottles.

Name: Serendipity
Description: Limited-edition blended malt from William Grant & Sons, created after an accidental vatting and released as a one-off in the 2000s.

Name: Sexton
Description: Single malt Irish whiskey matured in oloroso sherry casks; a Proximo brand distilled at Bushmills to the creator’s spec.

Name: Shackleton
Description: Whyte & Mackay blended malt inspired by Sir Ernest Shackleton, built on a recreation of the antique Mackinlay’s whisky.

Name: Sheep Dip
Description: Blended malt Scotch with farming roots in its branding; created by Spencerfield Spirit Co., now under Ian Macleod Distillers.

Name: Shortcross
Description: Irish whiskey from Rademon Estate Distillery (County Down), including notable peated single malt releases.

Name: Sideburn
Description: Limited blended malt release by Decadent Drinks/WhiskySponge—marrying 1992 & 1993 William Grant casks and bottled at natural strength.

Name: Silkie
Description: ‘The Legendary Silkie’—a Donegal-born Irish blend of malt and grain with a touch of peated malt from Sliabh Liag Distillers.

Name: Six Isles
Description: Ian Macleod blended malt marrying casks from Scotland’s island distilleries for a smoky, maritime profile.

Name: Slane
Description: Triple-casked Irish blended whiskey from Brown-Forman, produced at Slane Distillery in the Boyne Valley.

Name: Something Special
Description: Chivas Brothers blended Scotch introduced in 1912, known for a Speyside-led character and distinctive decanter.

Name: Spey Cast
Description: Vintage blended Scotch label noted for 12-year decanter bottlings and rare 1937 vintage releases.

Name: Spice King
Description: Wemyss Malts blended malt built on Island character—spice, subtle smoke, and a maritime note.

Name: Stewart's
Description: Historic blended Scotch with Dundee roots; today a Whyte & Mackay blend known for a spicy, fruity style.

Name: Storyman
Description: Small-batch blended Scotch created with Annandale Distillery and personally selected by actor James Cosmo.

Name: Strathcolm
Description: Single grain Scotch brand bottled by Angus Dundee—light, floral, and approachable in style.

Name: Té Bheag
Description: Gaelic Whiskies blended Scotch with a high malt content, matured in sherry casks and unchilfiltered.

Name: Teacher's
Description: Long-running blended Scotch (Highland Cream), founded by William Teacher and now part of Suntory Global Spirits.

Name: Teeling
Description: Dublin-built Irish whiskey brand and distillery known for innovation across small batch, single grain, and single malt releases.

Name: The Dead Rabbit
Description: Irish whiskey brand created with the famed New York bar; a smooth, approachable blend associated with The Dublin Liberties Distillery.

Name: The Gauldrons
Description: Campbeltown blended malt from Douglas Laing, marrying coastal, cereal-sweet notes with gentle smoke.

Name: The Guard Bridge
Description: Blended malt from Eden Mill St Andrews, named after the historic crossing near the distillery; crafted for a bright, malty Lowland style.

Name: The Hive
Description: Wemyss Malts blended malt highlighting honeyed Speyside character with soft citrus and gentle spice.

Name: The Last Drop
Description: Ultra-rare Scotch bottlings from The Last Drop Distillers—curated, very old blends and single malts released in tiny allocations.

Name: The Royal Household
Description: Prestige blended Scotch historically bottled for the British Royal Household; now an occasional export release with a refined, balanced profile.

Name: The Scotsman
Description: Vintage blended Scotch label tied to the famed Edinburgh newspaper name; mid-20th-century bottlings were popular in export markets.

Name: The Whistler
Description: Irish whiskey range from Boann Distillery (Drogheda), spanning blends and single malts with sherry and other cask finishes.

Name: The Woodsman
Description: Whyte & Mackay blended Scotch crafted for mixing, matured and finished with a focus on fresh oak and vanilla-forward sweetness.

Name: Thompson Bros
Description: Independent bottler based in Dornoch releasing small-batch Scotch single malts, grains, and occasional blends with distinctive label art.

Name: Timorous
Description: Limited-edition spin-off in the Timorous Beastie family from Douglas Laing—lighter, approachable Highland-style blended malt.

Name: Timorous Beastie
Description: Douglas Laing Highland blended malt named after Burns’s ‘wee, sleekit beastie’; honeyed cereal, citrus and gentle spice profile.

Name: Tullamore Dew
Description: Flagship Irish blended whiskey (often triple distilled), known for a smooth, biscuity style and wide cask-finished variants.

Name: Two Stacks
Description: Independent Irish whiskey brand blending and bottling small-batch releases (including the ‘Dram in a Can’) across malt, grain, and pot still styles.

Name: Tyrconnell
Description: Historic Irish single malt revived by Cooley/Kilbeggan (now Beam Suntory), noted for wine-cask finishes and a delicate orchard-fruit profile.

Name: Uam Var
Description: Vintage blended Scotch named after the Perthshire hill; mid-20th-century bottlings surface from various merchants for export markets.

Name: VAT 69
Description: Classic blended Scotch from William Sanderson & Son—rounded, sweet-spice style and long-standing global distribution.

Name: Waterford
Description: Irish single malt brand focused on single-farm ‘terroir’ bottlings, produced with traceable barley and detailed provenance.

Name: Watt Whisky
Description: Campbeltown-based independent bottler (Mark & Kate Watt) offering single casks and small-batch Scotch blends.

Name: The Whisky Exchange
Description: Retailer label for own bottlings—single casks and small-batch Scotch blends selected and released under The Whisky Exchange name.

Name: West Cork
Description: Independent Irish whiskey brand and distillery from Skibbereen producing single malt, pot still, and blends with a focus on approachable, cask-finished styles.

Name: Westport
Description: Blended malt label used for teaspooned Glenmorangie—independent-bottled Scotch noted for a light, citrusy Highland profile.

Name: Whisky Works
Description: Whyte & Mackay’s experimental line releasing small-batch blends and single malts with innovative maturations and finishes.

Name: Whistler
Description: Irish whiskey range from Boann Distillery (Drogheda), spanning blends and single malts with sherry and other cask finishes.

Name: White Heather
Description: Revived blended Scotch from The GlenAllachie Distillers Company, featuring richly sherried, age-stated releases (e.g., 15 & 21 Year).

Name: White Horse
Description: Classic blended Scotch dating to the late 19th century, historically linked to Lagavulin and famed for a gently smoky, malty style.

Name: Whyte & Mackay
Description: Founding house blend of Whyte & Mackay (est. 1882), a rich, rounded Scotch with a long export history and multiple age statements.

Name: Wildmoor
Description: Luxury blended Scotch collection from William Grant & Sons, showcasing bold, cask-driven profiles and launched initially for travel retail.

Name: William Lawson's
Description: Popular blended Scotch brand (Bacardi) known for a malty, easy-drinking style and strong presence in European and CIS markets.

Name: Wm. Maxwell
Description: Vintage blended Scotch label (‘William Maxwell’) from UK wine & spirit merchants, seen on mid-20th-century export bottlings.

Name: Woven
Description: Leith-based blending house crafting small-batch Scotch whiskies and creative blended malts, focused on flavour-first releases and experiences.

Name: Wright & Greigs
Description: Historic Glasgow whisky merchant and blended Scotch label, once owners of Dallas Dhu; vintage bottlings remain in circulation.

Name: Writers Tears
Description: Irish whiskey brand from Walsh Whiskey—typically a marriage of single pot still and single malt styles, noted for approachable, honeyed character.

Name: Yellow Spot
Description: 12-year-old single pot still Irish whiskey matured in bourbon, sherry and Málaga wine casks, bottled at 46% ABV.

Name: Yula
Description: Douglas Laing limited-edition island-style blended malt trilogy (20–22 years), featuring peated malts from Islay and other islands.

Name: Angel's Envy
Description: Louisville-based bourbon and rye finished in specialty barrels (notably Port for the flagship bourbon), founded by Lincoln & Wes Henderson.

Name: Antique
Description: Common shorthand for Old Weller Antique 107—Buffalo Trace’s high-proof wheated bourbon within the Weller line, prized for rich caramel and spice.

Name: Balcones
Description: Waco, Texas distiller known for bold, grain-forward American single malts and blue-corn whiskeys, often matured in Texas heat for intensity.

Name: Bardstown
Description: Bardstown Bourbon Company—Kentucky blender/distiller celebrated for custom blends, collaborative finishes, and sourced-plus-house bourbon releases.

Name: Barrell
Description: Barrell Craft Spirits—independent blender bottling cask-strength American whiskeys (bourbon, rye, American whiskey) from multiple distilleries.

Name: Barton
Description: Barton 1792 Distillery’s house label behind classics like Very Old Barton; producer of 1792 Bourbon and other Kentucky straight whiskies.

Name: Basil Hayden
Description: Jim Beam’s lighter-proof, high-rye Kentucky straight bourbon (formerly “Basil Hayden’s”), known for approachable spice and oak sweetness.

Name: Ben Holladay
Description: Historic Missouri label revived by Holladay Distillery; bottled-in-bond straight bourbon distilled and aged on-site in Weston.

Name: Benchmark
Description: Buffalo Trace bourbon line expanded into multiple expressions (e.g., Top Floor, Bonded, Full Proof) offering varied proofs and profiles.

Name: Bernheim
Description: Heaven Hill’s Bernheim Original—America’s flagship straight wheat whiskey—distilled in Louisville and known for soft vanilla-honey notes.

Name: Blade & Bow
Description: Diageo’s Louisville bourbon honoring Stitzel-Weller’s ‘five keys’; a Kentucky straight bourbon built via a solera-style mingling of aged stocks.

Name: Blanton's
Description: Buffalo Trace’s single-barrel Kentucky straight bourbon (launched 1984), traditionally dumped from metal-clad Warehouse H and famed for collectible toppers.

Name: Bond & Lillard
Description: Historic Kentucky label revived in Campari’s Whiskey Barons Collection, produced at Wild Turkey as a lighter, Old-style Kentucky straight bourbon.

Name: Booker's
Description: Beam’s cask-strength, uncut & unfiltered small-batch bourbon created by Booker Noe; released in named batches each year.

Name: Boondocks
Description: American whiskey brand from master distiller Dave Scheurich, known for mature straight American whiskey and cask-finished expressions.

Name: Boulder
Description: Colorado label (Vapor Distillery) producing American single malt and bourbon in Boulder with Rocky Mountain maturation.

Name: Bourbon de Luxe
Description: Long-running Kentucky straight bourbon value label in the Heaven Hill portfolio with roots in the mid-20th century.

Name: Bowsaw
Description: Irish-owned brand that bottles American whiskey/bourbon (often sourced from the U.S.) in Northern Ireland under the Kirker & Greer stable.

Name: Buffalo Trace
Description: Flagship Kentucky straight bourbon from Buffalo Trace Distillery in Frankfort; a benchmark, well-balanced house style.

Name: Bulleit
Description: High-rye Kentucky straight bourbon and rye brand from Diageo, styled as ‘Frontier Whiskey’ and popular in cocktail culture.

Name: Castle & Key
Description: Frankfort, Kentucky distillery restoring the historic Old Taylor site; produces bourbon, rye, and gin with a blend- and batch-driven approach.

Name: Catoctin Creek
Description: Purcellville, Virginia rye specialist (organic grains, pot stills), known for Roundstone Rye and cask-finished variations.

Name: Cedar Ridge
Description: Iowa’s first post-Prohibition distillery; produces bourbon and American single malt with Midwest grain and on-site maturation.

Name: Charlie Parry's
Description: Bourbon label associated with a Welsh drinks company but bottled as straight bourbon; approachable vanilla, caramel, and spice profile.

Name: Clyde May's
Description: Alabama-born brand famous for ‘Alabama Style’ whiskey and straight bourbon/rye, often finished with apple-influenced aging cues.

Name: Coppersea
Description: Hudson Valley, New York distillery using floor-malted grain and direct-fire copper stills; robust, grain-forward whiskies.

Name: Copperworks
Description: Seattle, Washington producer focused on American Single Malt, with diverse malt bills and cask finishes highlighting Pacific Northwest terroir.

Name: Daddy Rack
Description: Tennessee straight small-batch bourbon filtered through maple charcoal (Lincoln County Process) for a smooth, sweet-spice character.

Name: Distillery 291
Description: Colorado craft distiller in Colorado Springs; bold rye and bourbon often finished with toasted aspen staves for a signature profile.

Name: Driftless Glen
Description: Baraboo, Wisconsin distillery distilling and aging on-site; straight bourbon and rye featuring sweet corn, baking spice, and oak tones.

Name: E.H. Taylor
Description: Buffalo Trace’s heritage line honoring Col. E.H. Taylor Jr.; bottled-in-bond small batch and single barrel bourbons noted for classic sweet spice and oak.

Name: Eagle Rare
Description: Kentucky straight bourbon from Buffalo Trace, famed for its age-stated 10-year releases and a rich, toffee-vanilla profile.

Name: Early Times
Description: Historic Kentucky brand (est. 1860) known for approachable bourbon and bottled-in-bond expressions with mellow grain and caramel notes.

Name: Elijah Craig
Description: Heaven Hill’s flagship small batch and barrel proof bourbons—caramel, baking spice, toasted oak—named after the reverend often linked to charred barrels.

Name: Elmer T. Lee
Description: Buffalo Trace single-barrel bourbon created by master distiller Elmer T. Lee; elegant, honeyed, and highly allocated.

Name: Evan Williams
Description: Heaven Hill’s best-selling Kentucky straight bourbons (Black Label, Bottled-in-Bond), offering classic corn sweetness and oak spice at approachable proofs.

Name: Ezra Brooks
Description: Lux Row’s Kentucky straight bourbon range (e.g., 99 Proof, Old Ezra 7) known for bold spice, charcoal mellowing, and value-driven releases.

Name: FEW
Description: Evanston, Illinois craft distillery producing grain-to-glass bourbon, rye, and American single malt with assertive, spice-forward profiles.

Name: Four Roses
Description: Kentucky distillery and brand famed for ten unique bourbon recipes (2 mashbills × 5 yeasts) underpinning its Small Batch and Single Barrel expressions.

Name: Frey Ranch
Description: Nevada grain-to-glass distillery growing, malting, distilling, and aging on a Fallon farm; notable for straight bourbon and rye bottled in bond.

Name: Gentleman's Cut
Description: Kentucky straight bourbon launched by Stephen Curry; a high-rye recipe crafted and aged in Kentucky with a vanilla, baking-spice profile.

Name: George Dickel
Description: Tennessee whisky from Cascade Hollow Distilling Co.; charcoal mellowed and known for classic No. 12, Bottled-in-Bond, and rye releases.

Name: George T
Description: Shorthand used for the BTAC ‘George T. Stagg’ releases; see the full ‘George T. Stagg’ entry for the barrel-proof Buffalo Trace bourbon.

Name: George T. Stagg
Description: Buffalo Trace Antique Collection barrel-proof Kentucky straight bourbon—unfiltered, robust, and highly allocated.

Name: Green River
Description: Owensboro, Kentucky distillery brand (DSP-KY-10) revived with straight bourbon showcasing sweet corn, caramel, and oak spice.

Name: Heaven Hill
Description: Flagship label from Heaven Hill Distillery, including Bottled-in-Bond and heritage expressions alongside broader portfolio stalwarts.

Name: Heaven's Door
Description: Bob Dylan’s American whiskey brand featuring Tennessee straight bourbon, double barrel, and rye with creative cask finishes.

Name: Henebery
Description: San Diego–born whiskey label reviving ‘Henebery Celebrated Whiskey’; rye-led releases finished for a smooth, spice-forward profile.

Name: High West
Description: Utah distillery and blender known for marrying own-distilled and sourced stocks; standouts include Rendezvous Rye, Double Rye!, and A Midwinter Night’s Dram.

Name: Hirsch
Description: Modern HIRSCH Selected Whiskeys inspired by the A.H. Hirsch legacy—sourced bourbons (e.g., The Horizon, The Bivouac) bottled at approachable to higher proofs.

Name: Horse With No Name
Description: American bourbon infused with habanero essence for a spicy, peppery finish; designed for bold cocktails and sipping with heat.

Name: I.W. Harper
Description: Historic Kentucky bourbon brand dating to the 19th century; elegant, vanilla-forward profile with age-stated special releases.

Name: J.W. Dant
Description: Classic Kentucky straight bourbon with sour-mash heritage and bottled-in-bond expressions valued for old-school, corn-sweet character.

Name: Jack Daniel's
Description: Tennessee whiskey charcoal mellowed via the Lincoln County Process; iconic Old No. 7 plus Single Barrel, Bonded, and rye variants.

Name: James E. Pepper
Description: Revived historic Lexington brand/distillery producing rye and bourbon (e.g., 1776 line) with robust spice and heritage-driven branding.

Name: Jeptha Creed
Description: Family-run Kentucky distillery using heirloom Bloody Butcher corn; grain-to-glass straight bourbon and rye with rich, earthy sweetness.

Name: Jim Beam
Description: Flagship Kentucky straight bourbon from Beam, offering a classic peanut brittle, vanilla, and oak profile across a wide range of proofs.

Name: Johnny Drum
Description: Willett Distillery Kentucky straight bourbon (e.g., Private Stock) known for mature oak, brown sugar, and baking-spice complexity.

Name: Kentucky Gentleman
Description: Value Kentucky blended whiskey traditionally combining straight bourbon with grain neutral spirits for an easy, light-bodied profile.

Name: Kentucky Owl
Description: Revived Kentucky bourbon brand known for small-batch, high-proof releases and limited-edition blends crafted in a rich, oak-forward style.

Name: Kentucky Vintage
Description: Willett/Kentucky Bourbon Distillers small-batch Kentucky straight bourbon, a classic, well-rounded house blend from Bardstown.

Name: Kings County
Description: Brooklyn, New York distillery producing pot-distilled bourbons and ryes (including unique single-malt and peated variants) from organic grains.

Name: Knob Creek
Description: Beam Suntory small-batch Kentucky straight bourbon and rye; robust, high-flavor profiles with age-stated and single-barrel expressions.

Name: Kopper Kettle
Description: Belmont Farm Distillery (Virginia) brand producing Virginia straight bourbon and other whiskeys on traditional copper pot stills.

Name: Koval
Description: Chicago craft distillery specializing in organic, single-grain American whiskeys (millet, rye, bourbon) with a clean, fruit-forward profile.

Name: Leiper's Fork
Description: Tennessee distillery crafting small-batch bourbon and Tennessee whiskey with heritage mashbills and slow, pot-distilled character.

Name: Maker's Mark
Description: Loretto, Kentucky wheated bourbon famous for its red wax seal; soft, vanilla-caramel profile across classic and cask-strength releases.

Name: MB Roland
Description: Pembroke, Kentucky grain-to-glass distillery producing cask-strength bourbons and ryes from locally sourced corn and small-barrel aging.

Name: McKenzie
Description: Finger Lakes Distilling’s New York whiskey line (bourbon, rye, and single malt) distilled on-site with a balanced spice-and-vanilla house style.

Name: Mellow Corn
Description: Heaven Hill’s classic Bottled-in-Bond straight corn whiskey—80%+ corn mashbill with vanilla, corn sweetness, and light oak.

Name: Michter's
Description: Prestige American whiskey house producing small-batch and single-barrel bourbon, rye, and American whiskey with careful barrel selection.

Name: Never Say Die
Description: Kentucky straight bourbon brand with transatlantic roots; high-rye recipe noted for spice and citrus over sweet oak.

Name: New Riff
Description: Newport, Kentucky distillery known for Bottled-in-Bond bourbon and rye, often high-rye mashbills and single barrel selections.

Name: New York Distilling
Description: Brooklyn producer releasing Ragtime Rye and other grain-to-glass American whiskeys with New York–grown grain.

Name: Noah's Mill
Description: Willett/Kentucky Bourbon Distillers small-batch Kentucky straight bourbon—rich, oak-forward and bottled at higher proof.

Name: OFC
Description: Buffalo Trace’s vintage-dated, ultra-rare Kentucky straight bourbon honoring the historic Old Fire Copper distillery name.

Name: Old Fitzgerald
Description: Heaven Hill’s wheated bourbon line, including Bottled-in-Bond decanter series and classic, buttery vanilla-caramel profile.

Name: Old Forester
Description: Brown-Forman’s Louisville bourbon—continuous since 1870—spanning 86 Proof to 1920 Prohibition Style and Single Barrel offerings.

Name: Old Grand-Dad
Description: Beam Suntory high-rye Kentucky straight bourbon range (Bonded, 114) delivering bold spice, orange peel, and toasty oak.

Name: Old Line
Description: Baltimore distillery known for American Single Malt and rye, matured in Maryland’s climate for a robust, malty profile.

Name: Old Medley
Description: Kentucky straight bourbon from the Medley family lineage, released in small batches with classic caramel, oak, and spice notes.

Name: Old Potrero
Description: San Francisco rye from Hotaling & Co.; 100% malted rye mashbill showcasing pepper, cocoa, and toasted oak.

Name: Old Williamsburg
Description: Kentucky straight bourbon label long bottled for export/retail partners—vanilla-corn sweetness with gentle oak spice.

Name: Peerless
Description: Louisville distillery reviving the 19th-century brand; bottled-in-bond bourbon and rye distilled and aged on site.

Name: Penelope
Description: Modern bourbon house blending multiple mashbills (including toasted and cask-finished expressions) for a balanced, fruit-forward style.

Name: Pikesville
Description: Heaven Hill’s rye with Maryland roots—now Kentucky-made—offering dark chocolate, rye spice, and charred oak richness.

Name: Platte Valley
Description: Missouri-made straight corn whiskey from McCormick Distilling, often bottled in stoneware jugs with sweet corn and vanilla notes.

Name: Pure Kentucky
Description: Willett/Kentucky Bourbon Distillers small-batch straight bourbon (XO) known for rich toffee, baking spice, and oak depth.

Name: Pursuit
Description: Pursuit Spirits’ small-batch bourbons and ryes (e.g., Pursuit United), blending selected barrels for layered fruit, spice, and oak.

Name: Rabbit Hole
Description: Louisville craft distillery producing distinctive-mashbill straight bourbons and rye (e.g., Cavehill, Heigold, Boxergrail) with modern cask finishes.

Name: Rebel
Description: Wheated Kentucky straight bourbon (formerly Rebel Yell) from Lux Row, offering soft vanilla, caramel, and spice across multiple proofs.

Name: Redwood Empire
Description: Sonoma, California whiskey house blending own-distilled and sourced stocks; bourbon, rye, and American whiskey named after coastal redwoods.

Name: Remus
Description: George Remus Bourbon from Ross & Squibb (Indiana)—high-rye Kentucky-style bourbon highlighted by annual Repeal Reserve releases.

Name: Reservoir
Description: Richmond, Virginia distillery known for 100% single-grain whiskeys (corn, wheat, rye) bottled small-batch and blended into proprietary bourbons.

Name: RI1
Description: Beam’s modern rye (styled rī¹): a lighter, cocktail-friendly straight rye that helped spark interest in contemporary rye expressions.

Name: Rittenhouse
Description: Heaven Hill straight rye with Pennsylvania heritage; the Bottled-in-Bond expression is prized for robust spice and dark chocolate notes.

Name: Rossville Union
Description: MGP’s house rye brand from Lawrenceburg, Indiana—blends of high-rye mashbills released in ‘Master Crafted’ and barrel-proof editions.

Name: Rowan's Creek
Description: Willett/Kentucky Bourbon Distillers small-batch straight bourbon, traditionally bottled just over 100 proof with rich toffee and oak depth.

Name: Sagamore
Description: Baltimore rye brand blending high- and low-rye mashbills; Maryland-inspired style with core, cask-strength, and finished expressions.

Name: Santa Fe Spirits
Description: New Mexico craft distiller known for mesquite-smoked American single malt and other Southwest-inspired whiskies.

Name: Sazerac
Description: Rye whiskey line from Buffalo Trace (e.g., Sazerac Rye, 18 Year, Thomas H. Handy) with a spicy, citrus-led profile.

Name: SirDavis
Description: American whisky launched in 2024 as a Moët Hennessy × Beyoncé collaboration, blended/finished and bottled in Texas.

Name: Smooth Ambler
Description: West Virginia producer and blender behind Old Scout and Contradiction, bottling straight bourbons and ryes at characterful proofs.

Name: St George
Description: Alameda, California distillery (St. George Spirits) releasing American single malts (e.g., Baller) and other grain-led whiskies.

Name: Star Hill Farm
Description: Maker’s Mark’s estate wheat-whisky line—non-bourbon annual releases spotlighting regeneratively grown soft red winter wheat.

Name: Stoll & Wolfe
Description: Pennsylvania distillery reviving local rye traditions, bottling straight rye and single-barrel bourbons from Lititz, PA.

Name: Templeton
Description: Iowa rye brand with Prohibition-era roots, now known for age-stated straight rye and finished expressions.

Name: The Old Oscar Pepper Distillery
Description: Heritage Kentucky name associated with today’s Woodford Reserve site; used on select American whiskey releases referencing the historic distillery.

Name: The Story Of
Description: Independent label for American whiskies (e.g., ‘The Story of Bourbon’), releasing selected Kentucky straight bourbon at robust proofs.

Name: Thomas H. Handy
Description: Part of Buffalo Trace’s Antique Collection—a cask-strength straight rye famed for bold spice, citrus, and robust proof.

Name: Tincup
Description: Colorado-styled American whiskey and bourbons proofed with Rocky Mountain water; approachable rye-spice and vanilla profile.

Name: Traveller
Description: Buffalo Trace collaboration with Chris Stapleton—Blend No. 40—crafted to be easy-drinking with balanced fruit, oak, and spice.

Name: Uncle Nearest
Description: Tennessee whiskey honoring Nearest Green; award-winning portfolio highlighting charcoal-mellowed, vanilla-caramel richness.

Name: Van Brunt
Description: Brooklyn’s Van Brunt Stillhouse—American whiskey lineup (bourbon, single malt, rye) distilled on-site with a grain-forward style.

Name: W.L. Weller
Description: Buffalo Trace’s wheated bourbon family (Special Reserve, Antique 107, Full Proof, etc.) known for soft sweetness and baking spice.

Name: Walker’s
Description: Historic American bourbon label (e.g., Walker’s De Luxe/8-year) linked to Hiram Walker with vintage U.S. bottlings still found today.

Name: War Eagle
Description: Kentucky straight bourbon brand—vanilla, peach, and oak-spice notes—bottled at approachable proof for cocktails or sipping.

Name: Wasmund's
Description: Copper Fox Distillery’s Virginia American single malts and ryes—fruitwood-smoked malt and innovative chip-and-barrel aging.

Name: Wathen's
Description: Heritage Kentucky straight bourbon from the Medley family, typically single-barrel releases with classic vanilla, caramel, and oak spice.

Name: Weller
Description: Buffalo Trace’s wheated-bourbon line (e.g., Special Reserve, Antique 107, Full Proof), prized for soft sweetness and baking-spice depth.

Name: Westland
Description: Seattle distillery pioneering American Single Malt with Pacific Northwest barley, varied malt bills, and distinctive cask programs.

Name: Westward
Description: Portland, Oregon American Single Malt matured in new oak and finished in select casks; fruit-forward, robust malt profile.

Name: WhistlePig
Description: Vermont-based rye specialist blending estate and sourced stocks; known for bold, cask-finished ryes and limited farm-to-bottle releases.

Name: Widow Jane
Description: Brooklyn whiskey house blending sourced and house-distilled bourbons; limestone-rich proofing water and single-barrel releases are hallmarks.

Name: Wild Turkey
Description: Lawrenceburg, Kentucky distillery and brand—high-rye bourbons and ryes across 101, Rare Breed, and Russell’s Reserve lines.

Name: Wildcatter
Description: American straight bourbon with an oil-boom heritage theme; approachable caramel, vanilla, and spice at cocktail-friendly proof.

Name: Wilderness
Description: Legacy American whiskey label appearing on mid-to-late 20th-century bottlings; typically an easy-drinking, vanilla-led profile.

Name: Wilderness Trail
Description: Danville, Kentucky grain-to-glass distillery—sweet mash, low barrel-entry proofs—releasing well-aged bourbon and rye at robust proofs.

Name: Willett
Description: Bardstown distillery and independent bottler (Kentucky Bourbon Distillers) known for single barrel and small-batch bourbons and ryes.

Name: Willett's
Description: Label variant seen on select Willett Family Estate and historic bottlings; small-batch and single-barrel Kentucky straight whiskies.

Name: WL Weller
Description: Buffalo Trace’s wheated bourbon line (Special Reserve, Antique 107, Full Proof, etc.), noted for soft sweetness and baking-spice depth.

Name: Woodford
Description: Shorthand label used for Woodford Reserve family releases—Kentucky straight bourbons and ryes distilled in copper pot stills and column stills.

Name: Woodford Reserve
Description: Brown-Forman’s Versailles, KY brand (since 1996), known for classic Straight Bourbon plus Double Oaked, Rye, and Master’s Collection releases.

Name: Wyoming
Description: Wyoming Whiskey—Kirby, WY distillery producing straight bourbon and limited finishes with high plains maturation character.

Name: Yellow Rose
Description: Houston, Texas brand releasing straight bourbon and rye, including high-proof single barrels with rich caramel and oak spice.

Name: Yellowstone
Description: Limestone Branch’s Kentucky straight bourbon line (e.g., Select, Limited Edition), blending well-aged stocks for a balanced profile.
